gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On.
And Joseph went out over \add all\add* the land of Egypt.\f + \fr 41.45 
\ft Zaphnath-paaneah: which in the Coptic signifies, A revealer of secrets, or, The man to whom secrets are
revealed\f*\f + \fr 41.45  \ft priest: or, prince\f*

¶ And Joseph \add was\add* thirty years old when he stood before
Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh,
and went throughout all the land of Egypt.

And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by
handfuls.

And he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the
land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the
field, which \add was\add* round about every city, laid he up in the
same.

And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much,
until he left numbering; for \add it was\add* without number.

And unto Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine
came, which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On bare unto
him.\f + \fr 41.50  \ft priest: or, prince\f*

And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh: For
God, \add said he\add*, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my
father’s house.\f + \fr 41.51  \ft Manasseh: that is, Forgetting\f*

And the name of the second called he Ephraim: For God hath caused me to be
fruitful in the land of my affliction.\f + \fr 41.52  \ft Ephraim: that is,
Fruitful\f*

¶ And the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land
of Egypt, were ended.

And the seven years of dearth began to come, according as
Joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; but in all the
land of Egypt there was bread.

And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried
to Pharaoh for bread: and Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go
unto Joseph; what he saith to you, do.

And the famine was over all the face of the earth: and Joseph
opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the Egyptians; and the
famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.\f + \fr 41.56  \ft all the storehouses: Heb. all wherein
was\f*

And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph for to buy \add corn;\add*
because that the famine was \add so\add* sore in all lands.

Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said
unto his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?

And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt:
get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live,
and not die.
¶ And Joseph’s ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.

But Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren;
for he said, Lest peradventure mischief befall him.

And the sons of Israel came to buy \add corn\add* among those that
came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

And Joseph \add was\add* the governor over the land, \add and\add* he
\add it was\add* that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph’s
brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him \add with\add*
their faces to the earth.

And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself
strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them,
Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.\f + \fr 42.7 
\ft roughly…: Heb. hard things with them\f*
And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.

And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and
said unto them, Ye \add are\add* spies; to see the nakedness of the
land ye are come.

And they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy
servants come.

We \add are\add* all one man’s sons; we \add are\add* true
\add men\add*, thy servants are no spies.

And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the
land ye are come.

And they said, Thy servants \add are\add* twelve brethren,
the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest
\add is\add* this day with our father, and one \add is\add* not.

And Joseph said unto them, That \add is it\add* that I spake
unto you, saying, Ye \add are\add* spies:

Hereby ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go
forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.

Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be kept in
prison, that your words may be proved, whether \add there be any\add*
truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye \add are\add*
spies.\f + \fr 42.16  \ft kept…: Heb. bound\f*

And he put them all together into ward three days.\f + \fr 42.17 
\ft put: Heb. gathered\f*

And Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live;
\add for\add* I fear God:

If ye \add be\add* true \add men\add*, let one of your brethren
be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine
of your houses:

But bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words
be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.

¶ And they said one to another, We \add are\add* verily guilty
concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he
besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.

And Reuben answered them, saying, Spake I not unto you, saying,
Do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his
blood is required.

And they knew not that Joseph understood  \add them;\add*
for he spake unto them by an interpreter.\f + \fr 42.23  \ft he spake…: Heb. an interpreter was between
them\f*

And he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them
again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound
him before their eyes.

¶ Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to
restore every man’s money into his sack, and to give them provision
for the way: and thus did he unto them.
And they laded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.

And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender
in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it \add was\add* in his
sack’s mouth.

And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and,
lo, \add it is\add* even in my sack: and their heart failed \add them\add*,
and they were afraid, saying one to another, What \add is\add* this
\add that\add* God hath done unto us?\f + \fr 42.28  \ft failed…: Heb. went
forth\f*

¶ And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan,
and told him all that befell unto them; saying,

The man, \add who is\add* the lord of the land, spake roughly
to us, and took us for spies of the country.\f + \fr 42.30  \ft roughly…: Heb. with us hard
things\f*

And we said unto him, We \add are\add* true \add men;\add*
we are no spies:

We \add be\add* twelve brethren, sons of our father; one \add is\add*
not, and the youngest \add is\add* this day with our father in the
land of Canaan.

And the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, Hereby shall I
know that ye \add are\add* true \add men;\add* leave one of your
brethren \add here\add* with me, and take \add food for\add* the
famine of your households, and be gone:

And bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye
\add are\add* no spies, but \add that\add* ye \add are\add* true
\add men: so\add* will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffick
in the land.

¶ And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every
man’s bundle of money \add was\add* in his sack: and when \add both\add*
they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.

And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved
\add of my children:\add* Joseph \add is\add* not, and Simeon \add is\add*
not, and ye will take Benjamin \add away:\add* all these things are against me.

And Reuben spake unto his father, saying, Slay my two sons,
if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee
again.

And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother
is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way
in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow
to the grave.
And the famine \add was\add* sore in the land.

And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought
out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little
food.

And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest
unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother \add be\add* with
you.\f + \fr 43.3  \ft did…: Heb. protesting protested\f*

If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and
buy thee food:

But if thou wilt not send \add him\add*, we will not go down:
for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother
\add be\add* with you.

And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye \add so\add* ill with me,
\add as\add* to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?

And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our
kindred, saying, \add Is\add* your father yet alive? have ye \add another\add*
brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we
certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?\f + \fr 43.7 
\ft asked…: Heb. asking asked us\f*\f + \fr 43.7  \ft tenor: Heb.
mouth\f*\f + \fr 43.7  \ft could…: Heb. knowing could we know\f*

And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will
arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, \add and\add*
also our little ones.

I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him:
if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the
blame for ever:

For except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second
time.\f + \fr 43.10  \ft this: or, twice by this\f*

And their father Israel said unto them, If \add it must be\add*
so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels,
and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey,
spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:

And take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought
again in the mouth of your sacks, carry \add it\add* again in your
hand; peradventure it \add was\add* an oversight:
Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:

And God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may send
away your other brother, and Benjamin. If I be bereaved \add of my
children\add*, I am bereaved.\f + \fr 43.14  \ft If…: or, And I, as I have been,
etc.\f*

¶ And the men took that present, and they took double money
in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt,
and stood before Joseph.

And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his
house, Bring \add these\add* men home, and slay, and make ready; for
\add these\add* men shall dine with me at noon.\f + \fr 43.16  \ft slay: Heb. kill a
killing\f*\f + \fr 43.16  \ft dine: Heb. eat\f*

And the man did as Joseph bade; and the man brought the men
into Joseph’s house.

And the men were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph’s
house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our
sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion
against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.\f + \fr 43.18 
\ft seek…: Heb. roll himself upon us\f*

And they came near to the steward of Joseph’s house, and they
communed with him at the door of the house,

And said, O sir, we came indeed down at the first time to
buy food:\f + \fr 43.20  \ft we…: Heb. coming down we came down\f*

And it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened
our sacks, and, behold, \add every\add* man’s money \add was\add*
in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it
again in our hand.

And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food:
we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.

And he said, Peace \add be\add* to you, fear not: your God,
and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks:
I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.\f + \fr 43.23 
\ft I had…: Heb. your money came to me\f*

And the man brought the men into Joseph’s house, and gave
\add them\add* water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their
asses provender.

And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon:
for they heard that they should eat bread there.

¶ And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which
\add was\add* in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves to him to the
earth.

And he asked them of \add their\add* welfare, and said, \add Is\add*
your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? \add Is\add* he yet
alive?\f + \fr 43.27  \ft welfare: Heb. peace\f*\f + \fr 43.27  \ft Is your…: Heb. Is there peace to your
father?\f*

And they answered, Thy servant our father \add is\add* in good
health, he \add is\add* yet alive. And they bowed down their heads,
and made obeisance.

And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin, his
mother’s son, and said, \add Is\add* this your younger brother, of whom ye
spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.

And Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother:
and he sought \add where\add* to weep; and he entered into \add his\add*
chamber, and wept there.

And he washed his face, and went out, and refrained himself, and
said, Set on bread.

And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the
Egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians
might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that \add is\add* an abomination
unto the Egyptians.

And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright,
and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled  one
at another.

And he took \add and sent\add* messes unto them from before
him: but Benjamin’s mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they
drank, and were merry with him.\f + \fr 43.34  \ft were…: Heb. drank
largely\f*

And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the
men’s sacks \add with\add* food, as much as they can carry, and put
every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.\f + \fr 44.1  \ft the steward…: Heb. him that was over his
house\f*

And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the
youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the word that
Joseph had spoken.

As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their
asses.

\add And\add* when they were gone out of the city, \add and\add* not
\add yet\add* far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after
the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye
rewarded evil for good?

\add Is\add* not this \add it\add* in which my lord drinketh,
and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.\f + \fr 44.5 
\ft divineth: or, maketh trial?\f*
¶ And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.

And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words?
God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:

Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought
again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal
out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?

With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die,
and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.

And he said, Now also \add let\add* it \add be\add* according unto your
words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be
blameless.

Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground,
and opened every man his sack.

And he searched, \add and\add* began at the eldest, and left
at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.

Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass,
and returned to the city.

¶ And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house; for he
\add was\add* yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.

And Joseph said unto them, What deed \add is\add* this that ye have
done? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine?\f + \fr 44.15 
\ft divine: or, make trial?\f*

And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we
speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity
of thy servants: behold, we \add are\add* my lord’s servants, both we, and
\add he\add* also with whom the cup is found.

And he said, God forbid that I should do so: \add but\add*
the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you
up in peace unto your father.

¶ Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy
servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thine
anger burn against thy servant: for thou \add art\add* even as Pharaoh.

My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a
brother?

And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a
child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is
left of his mother, and his father loveth him.

And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may
set mine eyes upon him.

And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for
\add if\add* he should leave his father, \add his father\add* would
die.

And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother
come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.

And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father,
we told him the words of my lord.

And our father said, Go again, \add and\add* buy us a little
food.

And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be
with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face,
except our youngest brother \add be\add* with us.

And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife
bare me two \add sons:\add*

And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in
pieces; and I saw him not since:

And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him,
ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.

It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad \add is\add* not
\add with us\add*, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring
down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the
grave.

For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father,
saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame
to my father for ever.

Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the
lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.

For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad \add be\add*
not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on
my father.\f + \fr 44.34  \ft come…: Heb. find my father\f*

Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that
stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there
stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.

And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh
heard.\f + \fr 45.2  \ft wept…: Heb. gave forth his voice in weeping\f*

And Joseph said unto his brethren, I \add am\add* Joseph; doth my
father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were
troubled at his presence.\f + \fr 45.3  \ft troubled: or, terrified\f*

And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you. And they came
near. And he said, I \add am\add* Joseph your brother, whom ye sold
into Egypt.

Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye
sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life.\f + \fr 45.5 
\ft nor…: Heb. neither let there be anger in your eyes\f*

For these two years \add hath\add* the famine \add been\add*
in the land: and yet \add there are\add* five years, in the which
\add there shall\add* neither \add be\add* earing nor harvest.

And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the
earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.\f + \fr 45.7 
\ft to preserve…: Heb. to put for you a remnant\f*

So now \add it was\add* not you \add that\add* sent me hither, but
God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his
house, and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.

Haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, Thus saith
thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down unto me,
tarry not:

And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be
near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children’s children,
and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:

And there will I nourish thee; for yet \add there are\add*
five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to
poverty.

And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that
\add it is\add* my mouth that speaketh unto you.

And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have
seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.

And he fell upon his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept; and
Benjamin wept upon his neck.

Moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and
after that his brethren talked with him.

¶ And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh’s house, saying,
Joseph’s brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his
servants.\f + \fr 45.16  \ft pleased…: Heb. was good in the eyes of
Pharaoh\f*

And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren, This
do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan;

And take your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will
give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat
of the land.

Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the
land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring
your father, and come.

Also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of
Egypt \add is\add* yours.\f + \fr 45.20  \ft regard…: Heb. let not your eye spare,
etc.\f*

And the children of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons,
according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision
for the way.\f + \fr 45.21  \ft commandment: Heb. mouth\f*

To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to
Benjamin he gave three hundred \add pieces\add* of silver, and five
changes of raiment.

And to his father he sent after this \add manner;\add* ten
asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she asses laden
with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way.\f + \fr 45.23 
\ft laden…: Heb. carrying\f*

So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said
unto them, See that ye fall not out by the way.

¶ And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of
Canaan unto Jacob their father,

And told him, saying, Joseph \add is\add* yet alive, and he
\add is\add* governor over all the land of Egypt. And Jacob’s heart
fainted, for he believed them not.\f + \fr 45.26  \ft Jacob’s: Heb.
his\f*

And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said
unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry
him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:

And Israel said, \add It is\add* enough; Joseph my son \add is\add*
yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.

And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came
to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of his father
Isaac.

And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and
said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here \add am\add* I.

And he said, I \add am\add* God, the God of thy father: fear
not to go down into Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great
nation:

I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely
bring thee up \add again:\add* and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine
eyes.

And Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba: and the sons of Israel carried
Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, in the
wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had
gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacob, and all his
seed with him:

His sons, and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters, and his
sons’ daughters, and all his seed brought he with him into Egypt.

¶ And these \add are\add* the names of the children of Israel,
which came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.

And the sons of Reuben; Hanoch, and Phallu, and Hezron, and
Carmi.

¶ And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and
Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.\f + \fr 46.10 
\ft Jemuel: or, Nemuel\f*\f + \fr 46.10  \ft Jachin: or, Jarib\f*\f + \fr 46.10 
\ft Zohar: or, Zerah\f*

¶ And the sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.\f + \fr 46.11 
\ft Gershon: or, Gershom\f*

¶ And the sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Pharez,
and Zerah: but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons
of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.

¶ And the sons of Issachar; Tola, and Phuvah, and Job, and
Shimron.\f + \fr 46.13  \ft Phuvah, and Job: or, Puah, and Jashub\f*
¶ And the sons of Zebulun; Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel.

These \add be\add* the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob
in Padan-aram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons
and his daughters \add were\add* thirty and three.

¶ And the sons of Gad; Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon,
Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.\f + \fr 46.16  \ft Ziphion: or, Zephon\f*\f + \fr 46.16 
\ft Ezbon: or, Ozni\f*\f + \fr 46.16  \ft Arodi: or, Arod\f*

¶ And the sons of Asher; Jimnah, and Ishuah, and Isui, and
Beriah, and Serah their sister: and the sons of Beriah; Heber, and
Malchiel.

These \add are\add* the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to
Leah his daughter, and these she bare unto Jacob, \add even\add*
sixteen souls.
The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife; Joseph, and Benjamin.

¶ And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and
Ephraim, which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On bare unto
him.\f + \fr 46.20  \ft priest: or, prince\f*

¶ And the sons of Benjamin \add were\add* Belah, and Becher,
and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim,
and Ard.\f + \fr 46.21  \ft Ehi: or, Ahiram\f*\f + \fr 46.21  \ft Muppim: or, Shupham or,

¶ And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a

\ft according…: or, as a little child is nourished: Heb. according to the little

¶ And \add there was\add* no bread in all the land; for the

And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the

And when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land

And Joseph said, Give your cattle; and I will give you for your

And they brought their cattle unto Joseph: and Joseph gave

When that year was ended, they came unto him the second year,

Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes, both we and our

And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh; for the

And as for the people, he removed them to cities from \add one\add*

\ft priests: or, princes\f*

Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this

And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give

And they said, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find grace

And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt unto this
day, \add that\add* Pharaoh should have the fifth \add part;\add*
except the land of the priests only, \add which\add* became not Pharaoh’s.\f + \fr 47.26 
\ft priests: or, princes\f*

¶ And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the country of

And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years: so the whole

\ft the whole…: Heb. the days of the years of his life\f*

And the time drew nigh that Israel must die: and he called

And he said, Swear unto me. And he sware unto him. And Israel

And it came to pass after these things, that \add one\add*
told Joseph, Behold, thy father \add is\add* sick: and he took with him his

And \add one\add* told Jacob, and said, Behold, thy son Joseph

And Jacob said unto Joseph, God Almighty appeared unto me at
Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,

And said unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful, and multiply

¶ And now thy two sons, Ephraim and Manasseh, which were born

And as for me, when I came from Padan, Rachel died by me in the

\add is\add* Beth-lehem.
And Israel beheld Joseph’s sons, and said, Who \add are\add* these?

And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward

And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid \add it\add*

¶ And he blessed Joseph, and said, God, before whom my fathers

I have waited for thy salvation, O \nd LORD\nd*.

¶ Benjamin shall ravin \add as\add* a wolf: in the morning

The purchase of the field and of the cave that \add is\add* therein

And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered

And Joseph fell upon his father’s face, and wept upon him, and

And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm

¶ And Joseph went up to bury his father: and with him went up

And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which \add is\add*

And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw

¶ And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went

¶ And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and
